thread.title: Passengers ‘owed millions’ in flight delay compensation
thread.title_full: Passengers ‘owed millions’ in flight delay compensation

title: Passengers ‘owed millions’ in flight delay compensation
persons: London Gatwick Gareth Fuller/PA Dominik Lemanski
text:
Passengers ‘owed millions’ in flight delay compensation The worst British airport for delays of three hours or more was London Gatwick Gareth Fuller/PA The worst British airport for delays of three hours or more was London Gatwick Gareth Fuller/PA Dominik Lemanski   
Research by Which? has shown more than 500,000 people inconvenienced by more than three hours have failed to claim up to £422 in the last year alone. 
The consumer group found that between June 2014 and May 2015, 37 million passenger journeys to or from the UK were delayed by 15 minutes or more. 
About 900,000 people could be eligible for compensation, but only around one in four (38%) of them ever claim, Which? found. 
Passengers have to be flying Subscribe
